title: WATCH: Trump Promises Audience Full of Sailors a “12-Carrier Navy”
text:
Mad Dog Mattis May be Getting the Freedom He Needs to Destroy ISIS 
In a report published two months ago, the AP revealed that Trump had proposed “the biggest shipbuilding boom since the end of the Cold War to meet threats from a resurgent Russia and saber-rattling China.” 
But the truth was that the president hoped to do more than just big the military bigger. He also aspired to make it better. 
“We will have the finest equipment in the world — planes, ships and everything else,” he emphatically said. “We are going to have, very soon, the finest equipment in the world.”   
Listen to the entire speech below, or fast forward to the 17:35 mark to hear Trump’s promise to expand the Navy: 
“We also need more aircraft, modernized capabilities, and greater force levels,” he continued. “Additionally, we must vastly improve our cyber capabilities. This great rebuilding effort will create many jobs in Virginia, and all across America, and it will also spur new technology and new innovation.” 
A grander military, a larger Navy fleet, better technology and more jobs for both citizens and military soldiers — what is there to dislike about this?
